Enum Class BoardUtils

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<BoardUtils>
engine.forBoard.BoardUtils
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<BoardUtils>, Constable
public enum BoardUtils extends Enum<BoardUtils>
The BoardUtils class provides utility methods and constants for working with a chess board. It includes functions for validating coordinates, checking threats, evaluating moves, and tracking game progression. This class is implemented as an enum singleton to ensure a single global instance.

The class maintains information about board geometry (rows and columns), handles algebraic notation, and provides helper methods for various chess-related calculations.

Author:
Aaron Ho

    • initColumn

      private static List<Boolean> initColumn(int columnNumber)
      Initializes a list of boolean values representing the tiles in a specified column. Each element corresponds to a position on the board, with true indicating that the position is in the specified column.
      Parameters:
      columnNumber - The column number for which to generate the list (0-7).
      Returns:
      A list of boolean values indicating the tiles in the specified column.

    • initRow

      private static List<Boolean> initRow(int rowNumber)
      Initializes a list of boolean values representing the tiles in a specified row. Each element corresponds to a position on the board, with true indicating that the position is in the specified row.
      Parameters:
      rowNumber - The starting index of the row for which to generate the list.
      Returns:
      A list of boolean values indicating the tiles in the specified row.

    • initializeAlgebraicNotation

      private static List<String> initializeAlgebraicNotation()
      Initializes a list of strings representing algebraic notation positions for each tile on the chessboard. The positions range from a8 to h1, corresponding to tile indices 0 to 63.
      Returns:
      A list of algebraic notation positions.

    • isValidTileCoordinate

      public static boolean isValidTileCoordinate(int coordinate)
      Checks whether a given tile coordinate is within the valid range of tile coordinates on the chessboard. Valid coordinates range from 0 to 63 inclusive.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - The tile coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      True if the coordinate is valid, false otherwise.

    • getPositionAtCoordinate

      public static String getPositionAtCoordinate(int coordinate)
      Returns the algebraic notation position corresponding to a given tile coordinate. For example, coordinate 0 corresponds to "a8", and coordinate 63 corresponds to "h1".
      Parameters:
      coordinate - The tile coordinate to convert (0-63).
      Returns:
      The corresponding algebraic notation position.

    • kingThreat

      public static boolean kingThreat(Move move)
      Checks if making a specific move puts the king in threat. This is used to determine if a move is legal or would leave the player in check.
      Parameters:
      move - The move to evaluate.
      Returns:
      True if the move puts the king in threat, false otherwise.

    • isKingPawnTrap

      public static boolean isKingPawnTrap(Board board, King king, int frontTile)
      Checks if a king is pawn-trapped, meaning it is blocked by pawns and unable to move. This method examines if a specific tile in front of the king is occupied by an enemy pawn.
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the board.
      king - The king to check.
      frontTile - The tile in front of the king.
      Returns:
      True if the king is not pawn-trapped, false if it is trapped.

    • mvvlva

      public static int mvvlva(Move move)
      Calculates the Modified Value, Victim, The Least Value, Victim Attacker (MVVLVA) score for a move. This scoring system is used for move ordering in search algorithms, prioritizing captures of valuable pieces by less valuable pieces.
      Parameters:
      move - The move for which to calculate the MVVLVA score.
      Returns:
      The MVVLVA score.

    • lastNMoves

      public static List<Move> lastNMoves(Board board, int N)
      Retrieves the last N moves from the move history of a board. Useful for analyzing recent game history and detecting patterns.
      Parameters:
      board - The board to retrieve moves from.
      N - The number of moves to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A list of the last N moves, or fewer if the history contains fewer moves.

    • isEndOfGame

      public static boolean isEndOfGame(Board board)
      Checks if the current board is in an endgame state, either checkmate or stalemate. An endgame state means the game is over.
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the board.
      Returns:
      True if the game is in an endgame state, false otherwise.

    • isOpening

      public static boolean isOpening(Board board)
      Checks if the current game is in the opening stage. This is determined by the number of moves played so far, with fewer than 12 moves indicating the opening phase.
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the board.
      Returns:
      True if the game is in the opening phase, false otherwise.
